Protocols/TheBestClockAlarmViewDelegate..name: openAlarmEditor(_:)

Protocols/TheBestClockAlarmViewDelegate..name: TheBestClockAlarmViewDelegate
Protocols/TheBestClockAlarmViewDelegate..abstract: The delegate is very simple. We just call it to open the alarm editor.

Extensions/UIImage.html#/s:So7UIImageC8A.name: init(color:size:)

Extensions/String.html#/s:SS8AmkaManiE15.name: firstUppercased
Extensions/String.html#/s:SS8AmkaManiE15.abstract: This extension lets us uppercase only the first letter of the string (used for weekdays).

Extensions/String.html#/s:SS8AmkaManiE16.abstract: The following calculated property comes from this: http://stackoverflow.com/a/27736118/879365

Extensions/UIColor.html#/s:So7UIColorC8A.name: hsba

Classes/TheBestClockAboutScreenViewContr.name: corporateURI

Classes/TheBestClockAboutScreenViewContr.name: corporateName

Classes/TheBestClockAboutScreenViewContr.name: logoImageControl

Classes/TheBestClockAboutScreenViewContr.name: theURLButton

Classes/TheBestClockAboutScreenViewContr.name: longTextTextarea

Classes/TheBestClockAboutScreenViewContr.name: viewWillAppear(_:)
Classes/TheBestClockAboutScreenViewContr.abstract: This is called just prior to appearing.

Classes/MainScreenViewController/SongInf.name: albumTitle

Classes/MainScreenViewController/SongInf.name: resourceURI
Classes/MainScreenViewController/SongInf.abstract: The URL to the song resource in the library

Classes/MainScreenViewController/SongInf.name: description
Classes/MainScreenViewController/SongInf.abstract: This is a text description of the song

Classes/MainScreenViewController/TimeDat.name: time
Classes/MainScreenViewController/TimeDat.abstract: This is the time, as a locale-adjusted string. It will always use a colon separator between hours and seconds.

Classes/MainScreenViewController/TimeDat.name: amPm
Classes/MainScreenViewController/TimeDat.abstract: If the time is ante meridian, then this will contain the locale-adjusted AM or PM.

Classes/MainScreenViewController/TimeDat.name: date
Classes/MainScreenViewController/TimeDat.abstract: This will contain the date, as abbreviated weekday abbreviated month name, day of the month, year.

Classes/MainScreenViewController/TimeDat.name: TimeDateContainer
Classes/MainScreenViewController/TimeDat.abstract: This struct will contain all the info we need to display our time and date.

Classes/MainScreenViewController/SongInf.name: SongInfo
Classes/MainScreenViewController/SongInf.abstract: This struct will contain information about a song in our media library.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: screenForThese

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: amPmLabelFontSize

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: dateLabelFontSize
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is the base font size for the date display along the top.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: alarmsFontSize

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: alarmEditorTopFontSize
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is the base font size for the various textual items in the Alarm Editor.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: alarmEditorSoundPickerFontSize
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is the font size for the alarm sound/music selection picker.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: alarmEditorSoundButtonFontSize
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is the base font size for the sound test button.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: fontDisplayPickerView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the UIPickerView that is used to select the font.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: colorDisplayPickerView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the UIPickerView that is used to select the color.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: mainNumberDisplayView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the main view, holding the standard display items.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: mainPickerContainerView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is a normally hidden view that holds the color and font selection UIPickerViews

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: leftBrightnessSlider
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the hidden slider for changing the brightness on the left side of the screen..

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: rightBrightnessSlider
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the hidden slider for changing the brightness on the right side of the screen..

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: amPmLabel
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the label that displays ante meridian (AM/PM).

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: dateDisplayLabel
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the label that displays today’s date.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: alarmContainerView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This view will hold our alarm displays.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: editAlarmScreenContainer
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is a view that will cover the screen if the user wants to edit an alarm.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: editAlarmTimeDatePicker
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the date picker in the alarm time editor.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: alarmDisplayView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This will be the container for the flashing view that appears when there’s an alarm.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: flasherView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the view that will actually display the flashes.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: dismissAlarmEditorButton
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the invisible button that we use to dismiss the alarm editor.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: editAlarmScreenMaskView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is a partial mask view for our alarm editor screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: infoButton
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the little more info button that is displayed at the bottom of the setup screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: alarmEditorActiveSwitch
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This switch will denote the active state of the alarm.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: alarmEditorActiveButton
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the localized label for that switch, but we make it a button, so it can be used to trigger the switch.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: alarmEditorVibrateBeepSwitch
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the switch that selects whether or not to use a vibration (on supported devices).

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: alarmEditorVibrateButton
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the localized label for that switch, but we make it a button, so it can be used to trigger the switch.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: alarmEditSoundModeSelector
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the segmented switch that selects the type of sounds we’ll use.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: editAlarmPickerView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the picker view we use to select playback sounds for the alarm.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: editAlarmTestSoundButton
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the button that is pressed to test the sounds.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: shutUpAlreadyLongPressGestureRecognizer
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the STOP long press gesture recognizer.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: shutUpAlreadyDoubleTapRecognizer
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the STOP double-tap gesture recognizer.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: snoozeGestureRecogninzer
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the snooze tap gesture recognizer.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: musicLookupThrobberView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is a view that we temorarily put up while fetching the music collection.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: musicLookupThrobber
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the throbber in that view.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: songSelectionPickerView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the secondary picker view for selecting songs in the Alarm Editor.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: wholeScreenThrobberView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is a special view that we use to mask the entire screen for initial music load.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: wholeScreenThrobber
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the throbber in that screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: musicTestButtonView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the view that holds the test song button.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: musicTestButton
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the test song button.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: editPickerContainerView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is a container view for the main edit alarm picker (Sounds and Artists).

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: songSelectContainerView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: Thi is a container for the secondary music picker (songs)

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: testSoundContainerView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is a container for the test sound button.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: noMusicDisplayView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This view is displayed when there is no music available.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: noMusicAvailableLabel
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the label that specifies that there is no music available.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: alarmDeactivatedLabel
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This label tells the user that the alarm will not go off until next time.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: alarmDisableScreenView
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is a transparent view that allows gesture recognizers to disable the alarm.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: musicLookupLabel
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is the label that is displayed while the music is being looked up.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: alarmSounded
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is set to true if an alarm goes off. We then check it to see if we need to stop a playing audio loop when the alarm ends. Otherwise, we could keep playing forever.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: prefs
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: These are the persistent prefs that store our settings.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: currentlyEditingAlarmIndex
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: If the Alarm Editor is open, then this is the index of the alarm being edited. It is -1 if the Alarm Editor is not open.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: selectedFontIndex
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is the currently selected main font. It’s an index into our font selection Array.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: selectedColorIndex
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is an index into our color selection Array, denoting the color we have selected.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: selectedBrightness
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This indicates the brightness level of the screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: alarmButtons
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is an Array of the button objects that we generated for the alarms along the bottom of the screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: fontSelection
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: These are the names of the fonts that we have selected to be choices.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: colorSelection
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: These are all the UIColors that we have to choose from. They are dynamically generated.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: soundSelection
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: These are URL Strings of the various sound files we have for the sounds setting.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: backgroundColor
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is the basic background color for the whole kit and kaboodle. It gets darker as the brightness is reduced.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: timer
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is the heartbeat of the clock. It’s a 1-second repeating timer.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: fontSizeCache
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is used to cache the selected main font size. We sort of use it as a semaphore.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: songs
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This contains information about music items.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: artists
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is an index of the keys (artists) for the songs Dictionary.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: alarmEditorMinimumHeight
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is the narrowest that a screen can be to properly accommodate an Alarm Editor. Under this, and we need to force portrait mode.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: isLoadin
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is a simple semaphore to indicate that we are in the process of loading music.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: snoozeCount
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This records the number of snoozes. We use this if we don’t have forever snooze on.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: impactFeedbackGenerator
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This will provide haptic/audio feedback for opening and closing the editors, and for ending alarms.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: selectionFeedbackGenerator
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This will provide haptic/audio feedback for selection ticks.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: audioPlayer
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This will be the audio player that we use to play the alarm sound.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: currentTimeString
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This calculates all the time and date information when it is called.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: numberOfComponents(in:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: There can only be one…

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: pickerView(_:numberOfRowsInComponent:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This simply returns the number of rows in the pickerview. It will switch on which picker is calling it.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: pickerView(_:rowHeightForComponent:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This will send the proper height for the picker row. The color picker is small squares.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: pickerView(_:viewForRow:forComponent:reusing:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This generates one row’s content, depending on which picker is being specified.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: pickerView(_:didSelectRow:inComponent:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when a picker row is selected, and sets the value for that picker.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: loadMediaLibrary(displayWholeScreenThrobber:forceReload:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is called when we want to access the music library to make a list of artists and songs.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: loadUpOnMusic()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This loads the music, assuming that we have been authorized.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: dunLoadin()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is called after the music has been loaded. It sets up the Alarm Editor.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: loadSongData(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This reads all the user’s music, and sorts it into a couple of bins for us to reference later.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: playSound(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is called to play a sound, choosing from the various alarms. That alarm’s indexed sound will be used.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: playThisSound(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This plays any sound, using a given URL.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: pauseAudioPlayer()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: If the audio player is going, this pauses it. Nothing happens if no audio player is going.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: stopAudioPlayer()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This terminates the audio player. Nothing happens if no audio player is going.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: openAlarmEditorScreen()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This opens the editor screen for a selected alarm.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: closeAlarmEditorScreen(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This closes the alarm editor screen, making sure that everything is put back where it belongs.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: createDisplayView(_:index:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This creates the display, as a gradient-filled font.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: setAMPMLabel()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This sets (or clears) the ante meridian label. We use a solid bright text color.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: setDateDisplayLabel()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This sets the date label. We use a solid bright text color.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: setUpAlarms()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This creates and links up the row of buttons along the bottom of the screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: updateAlarms()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This updates the alarm buttons to reflect the brightness, color and font.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: addAlarmView(_:percentage:previousView:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This adds a single new alarm button to the bottom strip.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: checkAlarmStatus(soundOnly:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This scans the alarms, and looks for anyone that wants to ring their bell.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: aooGah(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This plays whatever alarm is supposed to be alarming. This will vibrate, if we are set to do that.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: flashDisplay(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This flashes the display in a fading animation.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: startTicker()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This starts our regular 1-second ticker.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: stopTicker()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This stops our regular 1-second ticker.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: updateMainTime()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This simply redraws the main time and the two adjacent labels.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: checkTicker()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is called from the timer.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: setUpMainScreenAccessibility()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is called at load time, to add the various localized accessibility labels and hints to our elements on the main display screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: setUpAppearanceEditorAccessibility()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is called at load time, to add the various localized accessibility labels and hints to our elements in the Appearance Editor screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: setUpAlarmEditorAccessibility()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is called at load time, to add the various localized accessibility labels and hints to our elements in the Alarm Editor screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: setInfoButtonColor()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is called to update the color of the info button in the Appearance Editor.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: turnOffDeactivations()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is called when the app is reactivated.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: hitTheSnooze(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when the user taps in an alarm active screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: shutUpAlready(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when the user long-presses in an alarm active screen.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: alarmActiveStateChanged(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when the user taps in an alarm on the main screen, toggling it.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: brightnessSliderChanged(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when a brightness slider is changed.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: brightnessSliderOpened(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when a slider opens, so we don’t have the situation where both are open at once.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: brightnessSliderClosed(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when an open slider closes. We re-enable both sliders.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: openAppearanceEditor(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when we first open the Appearance (font and color) Editor.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: openInfo(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when the user taps in the info button.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: closeAppearanceEditor(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called to close the Appearance Editor.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: viewDidLoad()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when the resources and storyboard are all loaded up for the first time.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: viewDidLayoutSubviews()
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when we are about to layout our views (like when we rotate).

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: viewWillAppear(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: This is called when the view is about to appear.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: viewWillDisappear(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: When the view will disappear, we stop the caffiene drip, and the timer.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.name: prepare(for:sender:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/c.abstract: When the view will disappear, we stop the caffiene drip, and the timer.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.name: openAlarmEditor(_:)
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html#/s.abstract: This is called to open the Alarm Editor for an indexed alarm.

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs/PrefsKeys.html.name: snoozeCount
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs/PrefsKeys.html.abstract: This is how many times you can snooze before the app gives up

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs/PrefsKeys.html.name: selectedColor
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs/PrefsKeys.html.abstract: This is the color selected for the fonts

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs/PrefsKeys.html.name: selectedFont
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs/PrefsKeys.html.abstract: This is the font we are using to display the clock

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs/PrefsKeys.html.name: brightnessLevel
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs/PrefsKeys.html.abstract: This is the fixed brightness level for the display

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.name: _mainPrefsKey
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.abstract: This is the key for the prefs used by this app.

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.name: _loadedPrefs
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.abstract: We load the user prefs into this Dictionary object.

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs/PrefsKeys.html.name: PrefsKeys
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs/PrefsKeys.html.abstract: These are the keys we use for our persistent prefs dictionary.

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.name: loadPrefs()
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.abstract: This method loads the main prefs into our instance storage.

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.name: minimumBrightness
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.abstract: This is our minimum brightness threshold. We don’t let the text and stuff quite make it to 0.

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.name: using12hClockFormat
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.abstract: This tells us whether or not the device is set for military time.

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.name: usingKilometeres
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.abstract: This tells us whether or not the device is set for kilometers.

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.name: indexOfWeekStart
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.abstract: Returns the 0-based index of the first weekday for the current calendar (0 = Sunday, 6 = Saturday).

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.name: weekdayNameFromWeekdayNumber(_:short:)
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.abstract: Gets a localized version of the weekday name from an index.

Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.name: savePrefs()
Classes/TheBestClockPrefs.html#/s:8AmkaM.abstract: This method simply saves the main preferences Dictionary into the standard user defaults.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.name: sounds
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.abstract: Play from a selection of preset sounds

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.name: music
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.abstract: Play a song from the music library

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.name: silence
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.abstract: Rely on flashing scree and, possibly, vibrate

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.name: isActive
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.abstract: Whether or not the alarm is currently active

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.name: isVibrateOn
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.abstract: Is the alarm set to vibrate when going off?

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.name: selectedSoundIndex
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.abstract: If sound, the selected preset sound index

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.name: selectedSongURL
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.abstract: If music, the selected resource URL for the song

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.name: AlarmPrefsKeys
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.abstract: These are the keys we use for our alarms dictionary.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.name: AlarmPrefsMode
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting/AlarmPr.abstract: These are the keys we use to specify the alarm sound mode.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.name: snoozeTimeInMinutes
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.abstract: The number of minutes we snooze for.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.name: alarmTimeInMinutes
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.abstract: The length of time an alarm will blare, in minutes.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.name: alarmTime
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.abstract: SAVED IN STATE: The time (HHMM) for the alarm.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.name: selectedSoundIndex
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.abstract: SAVED IN STATE: If the sound mode is sounds, the index of the stored sound.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.name: selectedSongURL
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.abstract: SAVED IN STATE: If the sound mode is music, the resource URL of the selected song.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.name: isActive
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.abstract: SAVED IN STATE: True, if the alarm is active.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.name: deactivateTime
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.abstract: EPHEMERAL: The time that an alarm was deactivated, so it doesn’t keep going off if we reactivate it.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.name: alarmResetTime
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.abstract: EPHEMERAL: The time to be used as the start of the alarm range. This can be bumped. If nil, then the set alarm time will be used to calculate the range.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.name: deferred
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.abstract: This handles deferring an alarm. That prevents it from going off immediately when turned back on.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.name: clearState()
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmSetting.html#/s.abstract: This just resets the three main ephemeral states.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.name: originalScreenBrightness
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: This is a special variable that holds the screen brightness level from just before we first change it from the app. We will use this to restore the original screen brightness.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.name: orientationLock
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: Used to possibly force orientation for the Alarm Editor Screen.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.name: window
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: This is the required app window object.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.name: delegateObject
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: This returns the application delegate object. Nil if an error (should never happen).

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.name: reportError(heading:text:presentedBy:)
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: This is a class function to display an error.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.name: recordOriginalBrightness()
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: If the brightness level has not already been recorded, we do so now.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.name: restoreOriginalBrightness()
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: This restores our recorded brightness level to the screen.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.name: lockOrientation(_:)
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: This will force the screen to ignore the accelerometer setting.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.name: lockOrientation(_:andRotateTo:)
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/s:.abstract: This will force the screen to ignore the accelerometer setting and force the screen into that orientation.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.name: applicationDidBecomeActive(_:)
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: We force the main controller to lay out its subviews, which will restore its internal brightness level.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.name: applicationWillEnterForeground(_:)
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: We force the main controller to lay out its subviews, which will restore its internal brightness level.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.name: applicationWillTerminate(_:)
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: We restore the screen to its original recorded level.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.name: applicationWillResignActive(_:)
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: We restore the screen to its original recorded level.

Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.name: applicationDidEnterBackground(_:)
Classes/TheBestClockAppDelegate.html#/c:.abstract: We restore the screen to its original recorded level.

Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.name: _paddingInDisplayUnits
Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.abstract: This is how much space we have around the control. The hit rect will be the entire control, but the slider will be inset by this much.

Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.name: _firstTime
Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.abstract: This is set to true, when the control is first shown.

Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.name: endColor
Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.abstract: These are the top color and brightness.

Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.name: draw(_:)
Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.abstract: This draws an elongated upside-down teardrop that appears while the control is being manipulated.

Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.name: beginTracking(_:with:)
Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.abstract: This is called when the user first begins a slide.

Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.name: touchesBegan(_:with:)
Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.abstract: This is called when there are touch (not necessarily pan) events on the slider.

Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.name: continueTracking(_:with:)
Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.abstract: This is called repeatedly during a slide.

Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.name: endTracking(_:with:)
Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.abstract: This is called at the end of the pan.

Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.name: cancelTracking(with:)
Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.abstract: This is called if the tracking was canceled.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.name: alarmRecord
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.abstract: This holds our state for the alarm we’re displaying.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.name: fontName
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.abstract: The name of the font to be used for the alarm display.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.name: brightness
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.abstract: The brightness to use for active alarm display.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.name: fullBright
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.abstract: This is set to true while the Alarm Editor is up. It tells us to ignore the set brightness, and display an active alarm as 1.0.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.name: longPressGestureRecognizer
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.abstract: This is the gesture recognizer we use to detect a long-press.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.name: desiredFontSize
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/s:8A.abstract: This is the size we want the display to be.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/c:@M.name: displayLabel
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/c:@M.abstract: This is the label object for the alarm.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/c:@M.name: layoutSubviews()
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/c:@M.abstract: Called when we will lay out the subviews.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/c:@M.name: draw(_:)
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/c:@M.abstract: The drawing routine. The display is rendered here.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/c:@M.name: longPressGesture(_:)
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html#/c:@M.abstract: Called upon a long press. We use this to open the Alarm Editor.

Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html.name: TheBestClockAlarmView
Classes/TheBestClockAlarmView.html.abstract: This is the view class for each alarm button. It is a button with a label in it. The label contains the alarm time and state.

Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.name: TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSliderView
Classes/TheBestClockVerticalBrightnessSl.abstract: This is a special control that is normally invisible, and appears when the user starts a vertical pan.

Classes/MainScreenViewController.html.name: MainScreenViewController
Classes/MainScreenViewController.html.abstract: The entire app is basically handled by this one big fat View Controller. The idea is that users don’t leave the context to do their settings.

Classes/TheBestClockAboutScreenViewContr.name: TheBestClockAboutScreenViewController
Classes/TheBestClockAboutScreenViewContr.abstract: This is a simple ViewController that manages the only other view controller in the app: The about box.

Classes.html#/c:@M@AmkaMani@objc(cs)TheB.name: TheBestClockMainDisplayView
Classes.html#/c:@M@AmkaMani@objc(cs)TheB.abstract: This is really just a placeholder. It does nothing but create a namespace.
